body.p: An Ohio-born attorney and soldier. His foster brother was William Tecumseh Sherman. Received his education from private tutors in Lancaster, Ohio. Attended the United States Military Academy at West Point from 1844 to 1848, when he resigned his appointment. Participated in the California Gold Rush in 1849. Practiced law in St. Louis, Missouri and Fort Leavenworth, Kansas. Returned to Ohio in 1852. Served on the staff of Ohio Governor William Dennison in May 1861. Served under George B. McClellan and William S. Rosecrans in the summer of 1861. Served as colonel of the 30th Ohio Volunteers. Promoted to brigadier general of volunteers on November 29, 1862. Commanded a division in the XVI Corps in 1863. Commanded the post of Louisville, Kentucky starting in February 1864. Joined Sherman in North Carolina in February 1865. Mustered out of the service in 1866.

bibl.p: Ezra J. Warner, Generals in Blue: Lives of the Union Commanders (Baton Rouge: Louisiana State University Press, 1988), 146-147.
